entry.title: RT Scott Johnsson: March '21/'22 cases with decisions within 160 days of oral: 30/32 (94%) Days since Grayscale (March '23) oral: 160 days Why should ...
entry.summary:
RTâ€‚Scott Johnsson March '21/'22 cases with decisions within 160 days of oral: 30/32 (94%) Days since Grayscale (March '23) oral: 160 days Why should we expect August? Because law clerks for DC generally cycle in/out this month, so judges aim to clear prior caseload before the new guard arrives.
Scott Johnsson:â€‚All of the March 2022 decided cases argued in front of the DC Cir were done within 154 days (save one outlier at 170 days). It's been 156 days since Grayscale was argued and there's only a small handful of remaining undecided March-argued cases.
